name: 0verkill
description: 0verkill is a bloody 2D action deathmatch-like game in ASCII-art, intended for people who want to play bloody games but do not want to use SVGALIB or X11. It uses a TCP/IP network for multiplayer games.
homepage: Not available in the package listing.
usage: After installing 0verkill, you can start the game by simply typing: overkill
features: Multiplayer Support: Play with your friends over a TCP/IP network.
ASCII Graphics: The game uses ASCII-art for its graphics, making it lightweight and runnable on almost any terminal.
No GUI Requirement: Unlike many other games, it does not require SVGALIB or X11, making it suitable for environments without a graphical user interface.

gameplay.objective: The main objective of the game is to eliminate other players in a deathmatch-style combat.
gameplay.controls: The game is controlled entirely via the keyboard, utilizing various keys for movement, shooting, and other actions.
gameplay.environment: The game takes place in an ASCII-art rendered environment, with different levels and maps for a varied gameplay experience.

additional_resources: While the official homepage is not available in the package listing, you can often find more information and community discussions on platforms such as GitHub, Reddit, or gaming forums.

community_and_support.forums: Check out forums and communities dedicated to retro and ASCII games for support and discussions.
community_and_support.GitHub: Search for repositories or forks of 0verkill to find additional resources, updates, or modifications made by the community.

name: 2048-c
description: 2048-c is a console version of the popular 2048 game. The game is played on a 4x4 grid by merging tiles with the same number to create larger numbers, aiming to reach the 2048 tile.
usage: After installing 2048-c, you can start the game by simply typing: 2048-c
features: Classic 2048 Gameplay: Enjoy the same addictive gameplay experience as the original 2048 game.
Console-Based: Play the game directly in your terminal without the need for a graphical interface.
Lightweight: The game is lightweight and runs efficiently on almost any terminal.

gameplay.objective: Combine tiles with the same number to create larger numbers, aiming to reach the 2048 tile.
gameplay.controls: Use the arrow keys to move the tiles in the desired direction. When two tiles with the same number touch, they merge into one.
gameplay.environment: The game is played on a 4x4 grid in the terminal.

additional_resources: You can find more information, updates, and community discussions on the GitHub repository.

community_and_support.forums: Check out forums and communities dedicated to terminal games for support and discussions.
community_and_support.GitHub: Visit the GitHub repository for additional resources, updates, or modifications made by the community.

name: 2ping
description: 2ping is a bi-directional ping utility that helps detect packet loss in both directions and measure round-trip time. It is useful for diagnosing network issues by showing packet loss and delays from both ends.
usage: After installing 2ping, you can use it by simply typing: 2ping <options> <destination>
features: Bi-Directional Ping: Measures packet loss and round-trip time in both directions.
Network Diagnostics: Useful for diagnosing network issues and performance.
Flexible Options: Supports various options for customization and specific use cases.
additional_resources: You can find more information, updates, and community discussions on the GitHub repository.

community_and_support.forums: Check out forums and communities dedicated to network diagnostics for support and discussions.
community_and_support.GitHub: Visit the GitHub repository for additional resources, updates, or modifications made by the community.

name: 6tunnel
description: 6tunnel allows you to connect to services using IPv6 from applications that only support IPv4. It acts as a proxy between IPv4 and IPv6 networks, enabling IPv4-only applications to communicate over IPv6 and vice versa.
homepage: Not available in the package listing.
usage: After installing 6tunnel, you can use it by simply typing: 6tunnel <options> <parameters>
features: IPv4 to IPv6 Proxy: Connect IPv4-only applications to IPv6 services.
IPv6 to IPv4 Proxy: Connect IPv6 applications to IPv4 services.
Network Flexibility: Provides flexibility in network configurations and compatibility.
additional_resources: While the official homepage is not available in the package listing, you can often find more information and community discussions on platforms such as GitHub, Reddit, or networking forums.

community_and_support.forums: Check out forums and communities dedicated to network proxies and IPv6 for support and discussions.
community_and_support.GitHub: Search for repositories or forks of 6tunnel to find additional resources, updates, or modifications made by the community.

name: 7zip
description: 7zip is a file archiver with a high compression ratio, supporting various file formats including 7z, ZIP, RAR, and more.
usage: After installing 7zip, you can start using it by typing: 7z [options] [archive] [file...]
features: High Compression: Provides high compression ratios for various file formats.
Multi-Format Support: Supports 7z, ZIP, RAR, TAR, GZIP, BZIP2, and more.
Command-Line Tool: Can be used directly from the terminal for scripting and automation.

usage: After installing 8086tiny, you can start the emulator by typing: 8086tiny [options] [disk image]

usage: After installing a52dec, you can start decoding audio streams by typing: a52dec [options] [file]

name: abduco
description: abduco is a terminal session management tool that allows users to detach and reattach to persistent sessions, similar to screen or tmux.
usage: Start a session with: abduco -c session_name
features: Session Management: Create and manage multiple terminal sessions that can be detached and reattached.
Lightweight: Minimal resource usage compared to more complex alternatives like tmux or screen.
Simple Interface: Easy-to-use commands for session handling without unnecessary features.

features: Boot Image Manipulation: Unpack and repack Android boot images for customization.
Kernel and Ramdisk Handling: Extract or replace kernel and ramdisk components within the boot image.
